{{Coord|39|32|45|N|119|49|00|W|source:placeopedia_type:edu|display=title}}
'''University of Nevada, Reno Arboretum''' is a state [[arboretum]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unr.edu/arboretum/|title=NRS527.330 Establishment; purpose; regulation of the state arboretum|date=September 22, 2008|publisher=[[University of Nevada, Reno]]|accessdate=March 29, 2009}}</ref> located across the campus at the [[University of Nevada, Reno]] in [[Reno, Nevada|Reno]], [[Nevada]].

The arboretum was established in 1985 and contains a collection of trees, shrubs, flowers, ornamentals and native flora, including over 60 genera and about 200 species of trees, many with several cultivars present. Thirty-six mature [[elm]] trees line the Quad.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unr.edu/arboretum/|title=Arboretum Board|accessdate=September 1, 2012}}</ref>

* Cherry Blossom Garden – Mt. Fuji [[cherry]] trees, [[azalea]]s, [[bamboo]] and ornamental [[Poaceae|grasses]].
* Benson Gardens and Xeriscape, with Challenger Tree Memorial – [[Malus|crabapples]], [[plum]]s, [[maple]]s, [[evergreen]]s, plus an area of drought tolerant plants. Blue [[Cedrus atlantica|Atlas Cedars]] commemorate the astronauts lost in the [[Space Shuttle Challenger disaster|Challenger Space Shuttle accident]].
* The Quad – The Quad was originally used as a parade ground for student cadets in the late 19th century and in 1908 replanted to [[Thomas Jefferson]]'s design for the [[University of Virginia]] lawn. In 1988, several elms were removed due to [[Dutch elm disease]]. The Quad is now planted with a mixture of elm, [[Celtis|hackberry]], [[Fraxinus|ash]] and [[oak]] trees, and the lawn is interspersed with weeping white [[birch]], [[oak]] and [[evergreen]] trees.
* Jimmie’s Garden – rock [[daphne]], [[hornbeam]], weeping [[Cupressus nootkatensis|Nootka cypress]], a Japanese [[Styphnolobium|pagoda tree]], [[Magnolia stellata|star magnolias]], [[rhododendron]]s, perennial shrubs and flowers.
* Fleischmann Agriculture Entry Landscape – [[magnolia]], spring-flowering bulbs and annuals. Trees include crimean [[Tilia|linden]]s, [[Fraxinus|ash]], blue [[spruce]], dwarf montgomery [[spruce]] and flowering [[pear]]s along the street.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unr.edu/arboretum/areas-of-interest|title=Arboretum Board: Areas of Interest|accessdate=September 1, 2012}}</ref>
* Merriam A. Brown Rose Garden – [[rose]]s.
* Manzanita Lake
* Joe Robertson Native Garden – plants from the [[Great Basin Desert]], [[Mojave Desert]] and [[Sonoran Desert]].
